Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 57th overall pick, by St. Louis in 1965...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/23/1968, off Bob Friend (PIT)...
Earned first career win on 5/7/1968...
Hit first career homerun on 4/28/1969, off Bob L. Miller (NYM)...
Injured on 9/23/1970 with a Bone Chips Elbow, out for 5-6 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1971, winning 2 games with a 1.59 ERA...
Traded from St. Louis to Chicago (N) on 5/12/1975 (Going to STL: P B. Edgerton, 3B J. Williams. Going to CHC: P R. Jarvis, P R. Sadecki)...
Won World Series with Chicago (N) in 1975...
